snippet: The world’s money is staying closer to home; global capital flow dropped 13 percent in 2012 from 2011, and is 61 percent below the peak levels of 2007.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column observes that world's money is staying closer to home; notes that estimates by McKinsey Global Institute show that global capital flows declined in both 2011 and 2012, when they were 61 percent lower than in peak of 2007.
lead_paragraph: The world’s money is staying closer to home; global capital flow dropped 13 percent in 2012 from 2011, and is 61 percent below the peak levels of 2007.
